title: Game lags very hard when killed

replies.body: I've experienced the same thing, and even saw it in a Solorenektononly video. I feel like it affects the last milliseconds of gameplay before death too.
For me, it affects about 0.5 sec before death and up to 10 sec after death.

When you say that it lags, could you describe it a bit more?  Does it seem like a massive FPS drop, or is it more of a connection type of lag?

With a bit more info, I might be able to help out!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=saFiBhomiYE

I actually found the video! It happens at 3:05

this is what mine looks, with it seeming to happen about .5 seconds earlier or later depending on the game (:

From all of the comments here, it definitely sounds like more of an FPS Hardware/software issue.  Currently, it looks like the game is having a hard time rendering death animations, which is why it freaks out for a very short period of time.  In order for us to rule this out as a possible root cause, make sure you complete all of the steps in our [Game Crash Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974).  There are a lot of steps there, but it should help in hopefully resolving this issue.

Give me a heads up if nothing seems to work!

This isnt fixed? It's still happening to me in 2017...
I even noticed it in Sp4zie's video but it was very mild compared to mine... lel

I think I know what OP is talking about, because I'm having similar issues. Like 1-0.5 seconds before death, thr game freezes until death, during this time the game doesn't recognize most commands such as: zilean self ult, summoner heal/barrier, kayle ult, and many other life saving spells.

This has been going on for many years, and I thought it was just because my laptop is getting a bit old, but now with other people talking about, I know it's not just me.

My internet is quite solid at 120mbps, so I'm not sure why this is happening.
I agree, when it happens as kindred I feel like it won't allow or won't recognize my ult command. So whichever issue would freeze fps and not allow commands, I'm not sure (:
What is the difference between two?

Fps is basically you can still play the game but you cant see whats happening because the Frames Per Second is too low to visually show what is happening compared to what you normally see. Connection Lag is when you seem to be okay but later on second or half a second you figure out what you saw going on isn't what was going on as the game has Interpreted it can also contain FPS lag where you dont see anything but none of your commands are going through either.
I have had this before and I looks like connection lag with FPS lag to me.
It's either a huge FPS drop, or a few short screen freezes :l

This has been ongoing for months now, and another Rioter commented that this is normal on your very first death, when the game analyzes and pulls up your first death recap. Which is still obnoxious, though.
still the same problem, is there a fix yet?

I've noticed this sometimes when I get multiple CCs on myself near an enemy turret if I'm very low health, it seems to lag right after CC has worn off which is when the time I would flash out or something but the command isn't registered even though I still had a 1-3 second window after the CC to easily flash out. 

I'll literally be hitting F over and over to flash out (or another champion's escape skill) asap when the cc is over and then the 1-3 second delay comes in and it's as if I wasn't pressing F at all. This weird and random delay seems to only happen under turret, and only when I'm low life.

This hasn't happened very frequently, but enough for me to remember it. I usually get no lag at all, 20 ms ping and ~60 fps, so when I do get delay it's very noticeable to me.
Bump, just since a few weeks having this too

There's a big difference. If everything keeps animating, but it doesn't take commands or show you the most recent behavior from other players, that's typically a network problem. Could be connection speed, ISP problem, firewall, or one of many other things, but ultimately, it's at the network level.

If the screen completely freezes, that usually indicates a problem with what's happening on the computer itself (CPU, graphics card, hard drive, etc.), which is an entirely different set of troubleshooting steps.

Hard to guess, but we recently fixed a somewhat similar problem on my wife's laptop by moving the League installation from the regular hard drive to the solid state drive, since apparently there was some "feature" where the regular drive would go into a sleep mode to save power and every time the game had to pull something from it, everything froze up for a second.

Of course, this is only one of very many possible solutions, but I thought I'd share my own experience just in case it helped someone.
